issue.title: [C++] Convert all non-accessor function names to PascalCase
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1133](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1133). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It seems Google has taken the "cheap functions can be lower case" out of their style guide. I've been asked enough about "which style to use" that I like the idea of UsePascalCaseForEverything https://github.com/google/styleguide/commit/db0a26320f3e930c6ea7225ed53539b4fb31310c#diff-26120df7bca3279afbf749017c778545R4277

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1133?focusedCommentId=16056579) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
The old guidance was "Functions that are very cheap to call may instead follow the style
 -for variable names (all lower-case, with underscores between words).
 -The rule of thumb is that such a function should be so cheap that you
 -normally wouldn't bother caching its return value when calling it in
 -a loop. A canonical example is an inline method that just returns one
 -of the class's member variables."

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1133?focusedCommentId=17039955) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Do we still have instances where we don't follow the rule?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1133?focusedCommentId=17040084) by Francois Saint-Jacques (fsaintjacques):*
If I come by some, I'll change them.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1133?focusedCommentId=17116045) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We can go about fixing any mis-named APIs as we run across them
